Options for Buyers to Sort and Search Items on the Scaled Cart Page

By default, the Scaled Cart page provides options for a buyer to search and sort all the items in the cart.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) only

Search

A buyer can enter a term for searching the cart's major line items (1). The search evaluates the following searchable fields on a CC Cart Item record:

Comments
External SKU
Product Name
SKU
Sort Name

The search evaluates all major items in the cart, not just the cart items shown on the current set of paginated results.

When the Scaled Cart page shows the results, a Clear Search button becomes available for the buyer to reset the search field and show all paginated cart items again.

NOTE
With all default settings, Cart Scale supports at most 2,000 total line items in the cart, including both major and minor line items. The search can return a maximum of 2,000 major line items. If a search query matches against more than 2,000 major line items, the Scaled Cart page shows only the first 2,000 cart items that match the criteria.
The search doesn't evaluate the prices of products.
The search doesn't support Boolean operators such as AND, OR, or NOT.
The search doesn't evaluate minor line items that are included in major line items.
B2B Commerce for Visualforce doesn't provide any configuration options for the default search behavior.
Sort

A buyer can sort the cart's major line items (2) by one of the following criteria:

Date Added
Date that the item was added to the cart. A buyer can sort in either:
Newest date to oldest date (default)
Oldest date to newest date
Price
The buyer's entitled price for the item in the cart. A buyer can sort in either:
Lowest price to highest price
Highest price to lowest price
Product Name
Name of the product in the cart. A buyer can sort in either:
Alphabetical order
Reverse alphabetical order

This sort criteria references each CC Cart Item record's Sort Name field, which references the corresponding CC Product record's Name field. B2B Commerce for Visualforce sets the Sort Name field when a buyer adds the product to the cart. B2B Commerce updates this field each time a full or partial reprice executes.

NOTE
The sort criteria applies to all the cart's major line items. When a buyer searches cart items, the search results can't be sorted.
After the buyer selects a sort option, the sort menu appears inactive, but the buyer can still change the selected sort criteria.
B2B Commerce for Visualforce doesn't provide any configuration options for the default sort behavior. For an example of extending the default behavior to sort by a custom field, see Extension Points for the Shopping Cart Page.
Search and Sort for an Internationalized Storefront

When your storefront supports multiple locales, each CC Cart Item's Sort Name field references the corresponding CC Product Item I18N record for the localized product name. If a CC Product Item I18N record doesn't exist for the selected locale, the CC Cart Item's Sort Name field is used as a fallback.

NOTE A customer service representative (CSR) who's logged in to the storefront on behalf of a buyer experiences the storefront in the locale specified in their Salesforce user settings. The CSR doesn't inherit the locale that the buyer selected on the storefront. For example, if a buyer has selected fr_FR but the CSR's user settings specifies en_US, the CSR experiences the storefront in en_US, not fr_FR. The Locale Switcher widget isn't available for a CSR to select a different locale. So, the CSR can experience the storefront in the buyer's selected locale only by changing the locale in their Salesforce user settings to match. To simplify the support experience, we recommend that the CSR continue to use their own default locale for searching and sorting items on the Scaled Cart page.
